triples.name: Event-driven architecture
triples.relevance: The paper proposes an event-triggered control scheme as the core contribution, moving away from time-triggered mechanisms.

triples.name: Markov chain
triples.relevance: Semi-Markovian switching systems use Markov chains to model state transitions in the cyber-physical system.

triples.name: Cyber-physical system
triples.relevance: The paper addresses control problems for cyber-physical systems, which integrate computational and physical processes.

triples.name: Man-in-the-middle attack
triples.relevance: False data injection attacks are a form of data tampering attack relevant to the security analysis in networked control systems.

triples.name: Lyapunov stability
triples.relevance: Lyapunov-Krasovskii functionals are used to establish stability criteria for the finite-time control system analysis.

triples.name: Delay differential equation
triples.relevance: Network-induced delays are modeled as delay differential equations in the closed-loop system model.

triples.name: Vertical take-off and landing
triples.relevance: A VTOL helicopter model is used as the application example to demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed finite-time control method.

triples.name: Control theory
triples.relevance: Finite-time control synthesis is a control theory methodology employed to design stabilizing controllers for the cyber-physical systems.
